user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I bought this blush wanting something a bit more summery. I normally use the Tarte blush so I was a little scared to stray but this is everything I wanted and more. It has a beautiful coral pinky hue as described. It is similar to Nars Orgasm but more coral. It also has quite of bit of shine that I don’t even both with highlighter when I’m trying to do a simple look which definitely works for me! It’s almost like a 2 in 1. I had so many messages from people asking me about it after the first time I wore it, it is such a beautiful shade. Wears beautifully and doesn’t make me break out. Would definitely buy again.

review_content: I love the colour and it stays on but I was disappointed it broke so easily. I didn't drop it, just gave it a tiny nudge to get it out the box and it crumbled.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Love it! It applies relatively heavy so you don’t need very much which is the only downfall...I like to build my colour. But aside from that, beautiful colour on olive skin and stays put all day. It’s a natural “flushed” look on the skin. Great clean brand so super happy these brands are conscious of bringing healthy products to the market. More products and colours please...love the brand!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
Very impressed by this wonderful blush! I’ve been using Nars Torrid for 20 years and wanted to go with a clean blush, so I decided to give RMS a try. I got the Crushed Rose color. This is my first RMS product, and I’m very pleased. The color is very pigmented, and for a sun-kissed look, I just tap my blush brush on it a few times to pick up the color, then tap the apple of my cheeks, bit on my nose, and very top of forehead. It looks like a bit of a sunburn that will soon turn into a tan. I just love it! The color is very much like Nars Torrid, and I think it has just as much if not better staying power. The best part is that it is clean, and I’m trying to switch to all green products. Will definitely give other RMS items a try. The compact itself is a little bit hard to open, but I’ve only had it a couple days. I think it’ll loosen up a bit the more I use it. Give this blush a try!
…read more

review_content: I love this blush. It's nice and pigmented but still easy to blend. It has a nice shimmer to it as well. I find that it lasts me all day.

review_content: Very pretty color and a little goes a LONG way -- quite pigmented. Not 5 stars because I'd love for it to be more easily blendable.

If I could give this 0 stars, I would. The color is lovely and it goes on really well however, the packaging is absolutely worthless. It is impossible to open. Within days of having it, while struggling to open it, i dropped it and cracked the powder. That was fine, I made it work. This morning while I was trying to open it, it flew open and shattered completed all over me, my robe and the floor. Absolutely garbage. I maybe got 5 uses out of it before I blushed my bathroom. There is no reason this needs to be so difficult to open.

review_content: This blush is so beautiful! It's like Nars orgasm but better! It is very pigmented so use lightly. Goes on so smooth, has longevity, not patchy or splotchy. Best of all its clean!!!! Thank you god for this beautiful clean blush!!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
It’s a very pretty light peach pink with subtle shimmer. It’s not as shimmery as Nars orgasm, which I like. It applies very Sheer, light so that you could use it as a highlighter. To get a decent amount on, you do need a few layers if your using a blush brush that lightly picks up product. You definitely would have to experiment regarding the right brush to use if you wanted to pick up more pigment instantaneously and not have to build it up. I wanted a blush that didn’t have talc in it anymore that was my main priority as well as a color that suits me I don’t do well with pinks so this fit the bill and it was really hard actually to find a brush that doesn’t have talc or or synthetic Fluorophoghite. It does last well too.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: least favorite blush I’ve used in awhile
review_content:
I didn’t like this blush at all, I don’t know why it’s described as coral because it’s not coral at all. It’s barely pigmented so I wouldn’t recommend the color if your olive skin or darker and I really REALLY wanted a coral color to give the glow within look but this isn’t coral. Worst part the blush isn’t matte there’s a sheen to it so it looks like I put highlighter over my blush which I HATE, not a flex but I have relatively nice skin and I feel like this blush accented my skin in a really unflattering way that made me self conscious and think my skin was bad! It’s not one star because you do get a good amount of product for the price.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This blush is a lovely color and looks great on my pale skin. I would just recommend being very light handed since a little goes a long way. I look a little sun burnt if I accidentally use too much, but it looks great when I’m light handed. This blush really does last all day and I’m very excited to try the other colors!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I have this blush in both crushed rose and lost angel and love both, but I was particularly surprised by the crushed rose. I would have thought it would be too intense on my fair skin, but it is actually incredibly natural-looking and flattering. It is very pigmented and a very little bit goes a long way. The only downside is that it is pretty fragile because it is so soft - I took lost angel traveling and it totally shattered. Luckily, I was able to put it in a loose powder container and it works great that way.

review_content: Very pretty color. Stays on most of the day. It is buildable but you honestly don't need much to get a natural blushed look. Loving it!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: This is a really nice clean alternative for Nars Orgasm. The blush is sheer and can definitely be built up which I like. The blush is great and the only thing I would change is the packaging. It is so hard for me to open this blush because the clasp is flush with the rest of the packaging making it tricky to open.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_title: Great blushes, make more colors, 3 is not enough!
review_content:
Crushed rose is perfect for a natural flush, it gives an almost sunburnt look. I love layering with Lost Angel, using Lost Angel at the top as the cheekbone as a highlighter, and then very lightly all over Crushed Rose. Im really liking these rms pressed blushes, they go on very easily and blend out perfectly. They look slightly radiant, but not overly glittery, and can be easily built up. I got all three, and use Moon Cry as an eyeshadow, and as a contour, but with a very light hand. I though that would be the one I would use the least, but its the one I am using daily. Very happy with these guys, was hesitant about buying all three, but am glad I did! The one negative I have noticed is that Lost Angel is a bit dry in the pan, and needs a bit more blending out to look natural. But it also looks beautiful as an eyeshadow since it is a bit more heavy.
…read more

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: Very similar to Nars Orgasm and super pretty on. However, after a few hours I looked in the mirror and saw all of these tiny red dots of concentrated pigment. When I tried to wipe them away they just smeared out bright red. So now I’m terrified to use it and it’s just sitting sad and lonely.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: At last my love has come along...
review_content:
This is now my favorite blush of all time.. and that’s quite a long time! I’m fairer than “fair,” and I quite thoroughly enjoyed both of their other pressed blushes, Lost Angel and Crushed Rose, yet a light swipe and this softly caresses my skin in the most perfect blushed color possible for my interesting hue. I’m so in love. Don’t be fooled, it’s not dark! It’s BEAUTIFUL! I think that from lightly using it to more intensely, this blush is a one and done color for every skin tone and depth of color. MAC had a color called Bikini Blush that I remember had a similar remarkable ability to adjust so well with such a beautiful color highlighting the face and flushing the skin. I’ve missed that so much! TRY IT!!!!!

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
This blush is quickly becoming my go to every day blush which can also be used as an eyeshadow. This is highly pigmented and even on my dark tan skin I have to use a very light hand when using this. When applied lightly it gives me very nice berry flush which leans towards neutral. I have also used this more like a contouring blush and it looks lovely. I really like the formula and it goes on very smoothly and lasts all day long. I love this color as an eyeshadow, I just use it as over all lid color and it lasts all day and doesn't crease. Overall I just love it.

review_title: FINALLY a clean swap for Nars Orgasm blush
review_content: FINALLY! I’ve been trying to find a clean swap for my all-time favorite, cult classic blush - Nars Orgasm. The Lost Angel color is, to me, all but identical. Goes on smooth, but you might need one extra layer to make it as pigmented as the Nars Orgasm blush.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Oily']

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Beautiful shade. It's the clean beauty nars orgasm. The first few times it was a little hard to apply but once I used it 3 times it was so gorgeous on. I think after you get past the first layer it's creamier. It is pretty sheer but I like that because I can layer it up.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I am so glad that RMS finally puts out powder blush. I like its cream highlighter and lip2cheek products but I feel the texture is a bit sticky. This blush comes with the same (mostly) natural ingredients without the sticky feeling. Crushed Rose requires a lighter hand as the color is vibrant. I also got Lost Angel which is more subtle / natural but buildable with color similar to Nars organsm blush.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I have long been a Tarte Amazonian Clay fan for a while, but I wanted a blush that was talc-free. This applies very nicely and Crushed Rose is a beautiful colour.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: not my favorite RMS product vs trio
review_content:
I love RMS for many products but not this blush. It is a similar look to NARS Orgasm I think but the feel isn’t terribly soft nor easy to apply. Feels harder in the pan and not a lot of payoff vs a very small amount of goldish peach glitter/ shimmer. Maybe if you prefer it as very light highlighter you would like it. I do however love the new RMS trio - bronzer, highlight and blush are much better in terms of soft silky feel, application and pigment.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: This an amazing dupe/even better version of a cult classic blush. The formula, wear, color and packaging is perfection. My new holy grail blush!!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: The formula is lovely, long lasting, and I believe all colors will suit any as they can be used very little or built up. This color is stunning and used alone or on top of another, imparts that blissful glow onto cheeks very much like another legendary blush by another name. This is clean, easy to use, and I love it as my all over color to give a clean sunburn/healthy glow to my extremely fair skin. It’s so beautiful.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Perfection in a clean powder blush. All shades are beautiful and effortlessly buildable so I feel everyone can use all three shades. This one is a beautiful brightening healthy pure flush of joy to the cheeks. The formula does last all day.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Best summer color! I was hesitant at first but crushed rose looks like a slight-sunburn cute flush! Lost angel is beautiful layered on top or on its own! Formula is beautiful, a little delicate so watch how you handle it or else the powder will crack.
